result.execSummary:
The defendant Jermaine Dwayne Douglas was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver Heroin (<3g) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(d)1.
  • Manufacture/Deliver Heroin (<3g) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(d)1.
  • Manuf/Deliver Cocaine (>5-15g) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(cm)2.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: Consecutive to any existing sentence currently being served.

superMiscConds.notes: Court orders the fines, costs, and restitution in this file shall be paid from all funds received into the defendant's prison accounts in accordance with prison policy, not to exceed 25% of gross during the term of initial confinement. If any fines, costs, and/or restitution remain outstanding at the end of the initial confinement portion of this sentence, then the remaining shall be paid as a condition of extended supervision.  ***Drug Buy Reimbursement Money in the amount of $1150.00 is Joint & Several with the co-defendant Alicia L. Beerbohm.***

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.  Defendant is prohibited from having any contact with co-defendant, Alicia L. Beerbohm.
Defendant to undergo an alcohol and other drug assessment and comply with any further counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: Consecutive to any existing sentence currently being served.

Transcript of Sentencing Hearing held 1/15/2016

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt: Case Called @ 2:40 PM: Defendant Jermaine Dwayne Douglas in court with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court has reviewed the PSI filed.  Counsel admit receipt of PSI.  No factual corrections offered or material errors stated.  Victim Rights in compliance.  Argument by DA.  Argument by SPD.  Statement by Defendant:  Yes.  The Court:  3 prong analysis explained.  Probation would unduly depreciate the severity of what happened in this instance.  Orders 6 yr  term of imprisonment, bifurcated as 3 yrs IC/3 yrs ES consecutive to any existing sentence currently being served - each of these 3 sentences are consecutive to that sentence - Waushara Counts concurrent to one another however.  Conditions of ES:  AODA and any follow thru as recommended; the defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician; Any other counseling or treatment agent deems appropriate; Court Costs plus DNA surcharge; $1150.00 Buy Money from 8/6/2015 transaction; No contact with A. Beerbohm; Eligible for CIP and Eligible for SAP; 33 days TS credit against sentence.  Defendant wishes to contest Drug Buy Money.  Court would expect that Buy Money was previously photocopied prior to use.  SPD not aware as per discovery received.  The record does establish sufficiently that there was purchase money and orders $1150 be reimbursed for that expenditure.  Appeal Rights Given.  No DNA specimen ordered - provided in a previous conviction.  Surcharge ordered as to each count and repaid up to 25% of earnings while incarcerated.

Sentencing hearing at 01-15-2016 02:15 pm

Case Called @ 2:45 PM: Defendant Jermaine Dwayne Douglas in court with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Per DA - plea to be entered today with PSI request.  Pleas will be entered to Ct Nos 1, 2 and 3 of INFO.  State will cap and argue for consecutive terms on current sentence.  Def and counsel concur with State's recital.  Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Terms of bifurcated SEH explained.    Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea Ct 1, 2 and 3 of INFO w/PTAC:  NC  Court accepts plea and enters JOC.  Ct Nos 4 - 7 All DRI.  PSI requested and ordered.  SEH Scheduled.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for January 15, 2016 at 02:15 pm.

records.addlTxt: Plea/sentencing hearing at 09-29-2015 02:30 pm

Case Called @ 11:20 AM: Defendant Jermaine Dwayne Douglas in court with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Preliminary Hearing and Time Limits discussed. Defendant wishes to waive preliminary hearing. Court questions defendant and accepts waiver of preliminary hearing.  Complaint describes facts establishing probable cause that felony level offenses occurred.  Def BOT.   ARGN to proceed.  INFO Filed and Stated - Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.   NGP receipted and entered as to all 7 charges in INFO.  Per SPD:  Rev agreed to on ES case.  P/S Scheduled - NOH Given.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 29, 2015 at 02:30 pm.

Case Called @ 1:22 PM: Defendant Jermaine Dwayne Douglas in court, in custody, with attorney Ben Szilagyi, both appearing via video.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Per SPD - eligiblity confirmed.  Per DA:  Believes there is currently a PO Hold in place out of Rock Co.  Argues for $3500 cash bond w/conditions - inherent flight risk.  Per SPD:  Due to ES Hold requests Signature Bond be imposed.  The Court:   Orders $3500 cash bond w/conditions.  IA Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.
